name: Factoradic class
description:
# Factoradic class

Pre-reading:

https://xkcd.com/2835

Develop a Factoradic class which allows you to create and use both positive and negative factoradic integers.

A factoradic number has a variable base.  The least significant digit is in base 2 and each more significant digit increases the base by 1.
Unlike the linked comic, we won't limit ourselves to 9 digit numbers, but continue in base 11-36 with the letters A to Z.

```
Base 10 Factoradic   |   Base 10 Factoradic   |   Base 10 Factoradic
      1          1   |        21        311   |      5038     654320
      2         10   |        22        320   |      5039     654321
      3         11   |        23        321   |      5040    1000000
      4         20   |        24       1000   |
      5         21   |        25       1001   |    999998  266251210
      6        100   |                        |    999999  266251211
      7        101   |       119       4321   |   1000000  266251220
      8        110   |       120      10000   |   1000001  266251221
```

Your class must be able to:
- cast factoradic numbers from base 10 integers, e.g. ```foo=Factoradic(125)```
- cast Factoradic numbers from factoradic strings, e.g. ```bar=Factoradic('1001')```
- be cast to int, e.g. ```print(int(bar)) # 25```
- be cast to str, e.g. ```print(str(foo))`` # 10021```
- do simple addittion, e.g. ```print(foo + bar) # 11100```
- do simple subtraction, e.g. ```print(foo - bar) # 4020```
- do simple multiplication, e.g. ```print(foo * bar) # 420021```
- do simple floor division, e.g. ```print(foo // bar) # 21```
- do negation, e.g. ```print(-bar) # -1001```
- do simple equality ```print(foo==bar*Factoradic(5)) # True```
- do simple comparisons ```print(foo>bar) # True```
